Sentencas: This study reports the physical properties and electrochemical behavior of La0.5Ba0.5CoO3-delta (LBC), a perovskite material and a potential candidate for the solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC) cathode.
Titulo: Characterization of La0.5Ba0.5CoO3-δ as a SOFC Cathode Material

Sentencas: LBC was synthesized by a solid-state route, and phase purity was checked by X-ray diffraction measurement.
Titulo: Characterization of La0.5Ba0.5CoO3-δ as a SOFC Cathode Material

Sentencas: Thermogravimetric analysis of LBC was performed both in air and in argon atmosphere to observe its phase stability.
Titulo: Characterization of La0.5Ba0.5CoO3-δ as a SOFC Cathode Material

Sentencas: Total conductivity, measured by a four-point dc polarization method, exhibited a pseudometallic-type behavior.
Titulo: Characterization of La0.5Ba0.5CoO3-δ as a SOFC Cathode Material

Sentencas: Ionic conductivity was determined in air over a 650-775 degrees C temperature range by a dc polarization technique using electron-blocking electrodes.
Titulo: Characterization of La0.5Ba0.5CoO3-δ as a SOFC Cathode Material

Sentencas: The high total conductivity, combined with a sufficiently high ionic conductivity (1.2x10(-3) S/cm at 650 degrees C), indicates that LBC possesses a certain degree of mixed ionic-electronic conducting nature.
Titulo: Characterization of La0.5Ba0.5CoO3-δ as a SOFC Cathode Material

Sentencas: The oxygen reduction behavior of porous LBC electrodes on a gadolinium-doped ceria electrolyte was studied in a symmetrical cell configuration by impedance spectroscopy.
Titulo: Characterization of La0.5Ba0.5CoO3-δ as a SOFC Cathode Material

Sentencas: The CO2 tolerance and the high temperature stability of the cell were also investigated.
Titulo: Characterization of La0.5Ba0.5CoO3-δ as a SOFC Cathode Material

Sentencas: Impedance spectra obtained at zero dc bias conditions consisted of two semicircular arcs, which indicate that the overall oxygen reduction comprises at least two distinct processes.
Titulo: Characterization of La0.5Ba0.5CoO3-δ as a SOFC Cathode Material

Sentencas: The area specific resistance (ASR) for electrode polarization was determined over a wide range of temperatures (600-850 degrees C).
Titulo: Characterization of La0.5Ba0.5CoO3-δ as a SOFC Cathode Material

Sentencas: The ASR value at 600 degrees C was determined to be 0.16 cm(2), which offers the promise of utilizing LBC as a cathode for low temperature SOFCs.
Titulo: Characterization of La0.5Ba0.5CoO3-δ as a SOFC Cathode Material
